Reference¶

Osbject¶

class Osbject¶
__init__(path, layer, origin, posx, posy, frame_count=None, frame_rate=None, loop=None)¶

Creates an instance of Osbject.

Parameters:
  • path (str) – Path to an image file, relative to the result file
  • layer (str) – Layer in the storyboard (Background, Fail, Pass, Foreground)
  • origin (str) – Origin of the image (TopLeft, TopCentre, TopRight, CentreLeft, Centre, CentreRight, BottomLeft, BottomCentre, BottomRight)
  • posx (int) – Implicit position on X axis
  • posy (int) – Implicit position on Y axis
  • frame_count (int or None) – Number of frames, if using animation
  • frame_rate (int or None) – Frames per second, if using animation
  • loop (str or None) – Type of loop, if using animation (LoopForever, LoopOnce)
add(args)¶

Joins a tuple and adds to list of storyboarding commands. Only for developers.

Parameters:args (tuple) – Tuple of strings to join
fade(easing, start, end, start_fade, end_fade, loop=False)¶

Changes the transparency of an object.

Parameters:
  • easing (int) – Type of easing to use (1 - 34)
  • start (int) – Time to start (ms) the fade
  • end (int) – Time to end (ms) the fade
  • start_fade (float) – Value of fade at the start (0 = invisible, 1 = fully visible)
  • end_fade (float) – Value of fade at the end (0 = invisible, 1 = fully visible)
  • loop (bool or None) – If is a part of the loop command
move(easing, start, end, start_movex, start_movey, end_movex, end_movey, loop=False)¶

Moves an object on X and Y axis.

Parameters:
  • easing (int) – Type of easing to use (1 - 34)
  • start (int) – Time to start (ms) the move
  • end (int) – Time to end (ms) the move
  • start_movex (int) – Position on X axis at the start
  • start_movey (int) – Position on Y axis at the start
  • end_movex (int) – Position on X axis at the end
  • end_movey (int) – Position on Y axis at the end
  • loop (bool or None) – If is a part of the loop command
movex(easing, start, end, start_movex, end_movex, loop=False, swap=False)¶

Moves an object on X axis.

Parameters:
  • easing (int) – Type of easing to use (1 - 34)
  • start (int) – Time to start (ms) the move
  • end (int) – Time to end (ms) the move
  • start_movex (int) – Position on X axis at the start
  • end_movex (int) – Position on X axis at the end
  • loop (bool or None) – If is a part of the loop command
  • swap – Change axis to Y (use movey method instead)
movey(easing, start, end, start_movey, end_movey, loop=False)¶

Moves an object on Y axis.

Parameters:
  • easing (int) – Type of easing to use (1 - 34)
  • start (int) – Time to start (ms) the move
  • end (int) – Time to end (ms) the move
  • start_movey (int) – Position on Y axis at the start
  • end_movey (int) – Position on Y axis at the end
  • loop (bool or None) – If is a part of the loop command
scale(easing, start, end, start_scale, end_scale, loop=False)¶

Scales an object up or down.

Parameters:
  • easing (int) – Type of easing to use (1 - 34)
  • start (int) – Time to start (ms) the scale
  • end (int) – Time to end (ms) the scale
  • start_scale (float) – Value of scale at the start
  • end_scale (float) – Value of scale at the end
  • loop (bool or None) – If is a part of the loop command
vecscale(easing, start, end, start_scalex, start_scaley, end_scalex, end_scaley, loop=False)¶

Scale an object disproportionately on X and Y axis.

Parameters:
  • easing (int) – Type of easing to use (1 - 34)
  • start (int) – Time to start (ms) the vector scale
  • end (int) – Time to end (ms) the vector scale
  • start_scalex (float) – Value of scale at the start on X axis
  • start_scaley (float) – Value of scale at the start on Y axis
  • end_scalex (float) – Value of scale at the end on X axis
  • end_scaley (float) – Value of scale at the end on Y axis
  • loop (bool or None) – If is a part of the loop command
rotate(easing, start, end, start_rotate, end_rotate, loop=False)¶

Rotates an object.

Parameters:
  • easing (int) – Type of easing to use (1 - 34)
  • start (int) – Time to start (ms) the rotation
  • end (int) – Time to end (ms) the rotation
  • start_rotate (float) – Value of rotation at the start
  • end_rotate (float) – Value of rotation at the end
  • loop (bool or None) – If is a part of the loop command
colour(easing, start, end, r, g, b, end_r, end_g, end_b, loop=False)¶

Changes a color of an object. May not work as intended with non-grayscale images.

Parameters:
  • easing (int) – Type of easing to use (1 - 34)
  • start (int) – Time to start (ms) the colour change
  • end (int) – Time to end (ms) the colour change
  • r (int) – Value of red colour (0 - 255) at the start
  • g (int) – Value of green colour (0 - 255) at the start
  • b (int) – Value of blue colour (0 - 255) at the start
  • end_r (int) – Value of red colour (0 - 255) at the end
  • end_g (int) – Value of green colour (0 - 255) at the end
  • end_b (int) – Value of blue colour (0 - 255) at the end
  • loop (bool or None) – If is a part of the loop command
para(easing, start, end, parameter)¶

Applies storyboarding parameter to an object.

Parameters:
  • easing (int) – Type of easing to use (1 - 34)
  • start (int) – Time to start (ms) the parameter
  • end (int) – Time to end (ms) the fade
  • parameter (str) – Storyboarding parameter (H, V, A)
loop(start, loop_count)¶

Creates a loop of storyboarding commands. To utilize this, affected methods must set loop to True.

Parameters:
  • start (int) – Time to start (ms) the loop
  • loop_count (int) – Times to repeat the loop.
trigger(trigger, start, loop_count)¶

Creates a trigger to run commands on a specific action.

Parameters:
  • trigger (str) – Type of trigger (Failing, Passing, or HitSound[…])
  • start (int) – Time to start (ms) the fade
  • loop_count (int) – Times to repeat the loop.
static minimize(variable, force=False)¶

Creates a variable for a string.

Parameters:
  • variable (str) – String to minimize
  • force (bool or None) – If minimization should be forced
classmethod end(osb_file)¶

Creates an output .osb file.

Parameters:osb_file (str) – Path to the output file
classmethod end_minimize(osb_file)¶

Creates an output .osb file, utilizes minimization.

Parameters:osb_file (str) – Path to the output file
classmethod set_minimize_threshold(threshold)¶

Sets a threshold for minimization.

Parameters:threshold (int) – Maximum length of a string to minimize
classmethod set_minimize_time(value)¶

Sets whether time values should be minimized.

Parameters:value (bool) – If time should be minimized
classmethod minimize_force(variable)¶

Creates a variable for a string regardless of threshold.

Parameters:variable (str) – String to minimize

Additional functions¶

sine(har, radius, height)¶

Creates a list of sine Y values. For usage in spectrum or sine-like patterns.

Parameters:
  • har (int) – Number of samples
  • radius (float) – Multiplication of the sine
  • height (int) – Height of the sine
Returns:

List of sine Y values
Return type:

list
generate_circle(r, n)¶

Generates values to create a circle. Used by circle.

Parameters:
  • r (list) – Radius
  • n (list) – Number of samples
Returns:

X and Y values of the circle
Return type:

(float, float)
circle(har, radius)¶

Creates a circle.

Parameters:
  • har (float) – Number of samples
  • r (int) – Radius
Returns:

X and Y positions of the circle
Return type:

(dict, dict)
variable_name()¶

Creates a variable name for minimization in the storyboard file.

Returns:Variable name
Return type:str
check_path(path)¶

Checks if path is valid.

Parameters:path (str) – Path to check
Returns:True if is valid
Return type:bool
check_layer(layer)¶

Checks if layer is valid.

Parameters:layer (str) – Layer to check
Returns:True if is valid
Return type:bool
check_origin(origin)¶

Checks if origin is valid.

Parameters:origin (str) – Origin to check
Returns:True if is valid
Return type:bool
check_int(integer)¶

Checks if value is integer.

Parameters:integer (int) – Value to check
Returns:True if is valid
Return type:bool
check_easing(easing)¶

Checks if easing is valid.

Parameters:easing (int) – Easing to check
Returns:True if is valid
Return type:bool
check_loop(loop)¶

Checks if loop is valid.

Parameters:loop (str) – Loop to check
Returns:True if is valid
Return type:bool
check_dec(dec)¶

Checks if value is decimal.

Parameters:dec (float) – Value to check
Returns:True if is valid
Return type:bool
check_time(start, end)¶

Checks if time is valid.

Parameters:
  • start (int) – Start time to check
  • end (int) – End time to check
Returns:

True if is valid
Return type:

bool
check_colours(args)¶

Checks if colors are valid.

Parameters:args (tuple) – Colors to check.
Returns:True if is valid
Return type:bool
check_trigger(trigger)¶

Checks if trigger is valid.

Parameters:trigger (str) – Trigger to check
Returns:True if is valid
Return type:bool
spectrum(wav_file, bar_file, mi, mx, har, start, end, posx, posy, layer, origin, gap=0, arrange="", radius=30, sine_height=6.1)¶

Creates a spectrum from a wave file.

Parameters:
  • wav_file (str) – Path to wave (.wav) file (Use a file without metadata in case of issues)
  • bar_file (str) – Path to an image file, relative to the result file
  • mi (float) – Minimum height of the spectrum
  • mx (float) – Maximum height of the spectrum
  • har (int) – Number of samples
  • start (int) – Start time of the spectrum
  • end (int) – End time of the spectrum
  • posx (int) – Position of the spectrum on X axis
  • posy (int) – Position of the spectrum on Y axis
  • layer (str) – Layer in the storyboard (Background, Fail, Pass, Foreground)
  • origin (str) – Origin of the image (TopLeft, TopCentre, TopRight, CentreLeft, Centre, CentreRight, BottomLeft, BottomCentre, BottomRight)
  • gap (int) – Gap between each bar
  • arrange (string) – How to arrange the spectrum (circle, sine) or empty for line
  • radius (float) – Radius of the sine
  • sine_height (float) – Height of the sine
Returns:

List of Osbjects
Return type:

list
